title: Bug 22360 - FontRegistry cannot be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource
description: Bug 22360 - FontRegistry cannot be instantiated using resources outside org.eclipse.jface.resource. Therefore, all the resources that are being looked up are the only ones relative to the location of the FontRegistry class (org.eclipse.jface.resource path). It can be remedied if FontRegistry took a client class (or class loader) as an additional parameter to the constructor.
OB: When trying to create a FontRegistry instance for an application using resources outside the org.eclipse.jface.resource package, a MissingResourceException is thrown.
EB: Alternatively, the FontRegistry should allow clients to load their own resource bundle and take it as a parameter to the constructor (instead of the name of the bundle).
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a class com.company.product.MyClass. 2. In the MyClass, add the method createFontRegistry(). 3. In the createFontRegistry() method, try to create a FontRegistry using resources outside the org.eclipse.jface.resource package. For example: FontRegistry fonts = new FontRegistry("com.company.product.fonts"). 4. Observe the MissingResourceException being thrown.
